column4: Any ubuntu mail server admins here, I have a few technical questions regarding 'bounces' for you.

I have a ruby mailing daemon that uses postfix to send email. When I send one to "billybob@yoyo.com" and the MTA at yoyo.com decides to accept the mailing for the time being. 20 mins later it kicks back a 5.x.x error. There is no way for the mailer daemon to know the success of that mailing. And to throw another curveball, oftentimes when an MTA bounces the message you don't get an original copy of it
How can i effectively track bounces? Postfix appears to be really made to be more of a general purpose MTA
